meanings.definition: To become or make wrinkled or contracted
meanings.sent1: The heat caused the leaves to shrivel up and become dry.
meanings.sent2: If you leave the fruit out for too long, it will shrivel and lose its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The poor little plant started to shrivel when it realized it was being overwatered.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes began to shrivel like a flower without sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The old paper began to shrivel at the edges, showing its age.

meanings.sent1: Without water, the flowers will shrivel and wilt.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the bread out will cause it to shrivel and become stale.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to shrivel as soon as it was pricked by a needle.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm began to shrivel as the project faced more challenges.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting began to shrivel over time.
